The *Mini Balance Evaluation Systems Test* also known as the *Mini-BESTest* consists of 14 items that evaluate different aspects of balance:

- [Anticipatory postural adjustments](#form-anticipatory)
- [Reactive postural control](#form-reactive-postural-control)
- [Sensory orientation](#form-sensory-orientation)
- [Dynamic gait](#form-dynamic-gait)

Each item is scored from 0 (worst) to 2 (best/normal) for a maximum of 28 total points.


The Mini-BEStest is most notably used in pathological populations, such as: Stroke, [Parkinson's disease](#parkinsons-disease), Multiple sclerosis (MS), Peripheral neuropathy secondary to Type 2 diabetes

# Psychometrics

MCID 
4 points- Early subacute stroke (Tamura et al, 2024)
4 points - Parkinson's (Godi, 2020)

| Population | MCID |
|-|-|
| Early subacute stroke | 4pts @tamuraPooledMinimalClinically2024 |
| Parkinson's disease | 4pts @godiResponsivenessMinimalClinically2020 |

# Parkinson's Disease

King et al @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012 attempted to find a cut-off points of the *Mini-BESTest* to differentiate patients with and without postural response deficits @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012.
When using a a cutoff of &gt;21/28 pts, postural response deficits could be differentiated with a sensitivity of 0.89 and a specificity of 0.81 @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012.

In patients with mild PD, the results of the *Mini-BESTest* are highly correlated with the *Berg Balance Scale (BBS)* (r = 0.79, P < 0.001), while experiencing less significant ceililng effects that the BBS suffers from @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012.


Mini-BESTest is more effective than the Berg for predicting the [motor score on the *Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS)*]({{< var ref-unified-parkinsons-disease-rating-scale.path >}}) and for discriminating between those with and without postural response deficits as measured by the [Hoehn and Yahr (H&Y) scale]({{< ref-hoehn-and-yahr-scale.path >}})  @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012.

# Indications

Clinicians are saturated with potential measures of balance, so how does the *Mini-BESTest* fit into one's toolkit?

In studies on patients with Parkinson's disease @kingComparingMiniBESTestBerg2012, multiple sclerosis @rossCohortStudyComparing2016 and spinal cord injuries @jorgensenComparisonBergBalance2017, the *Mini-BESTest* had a less significant ceiling effect and higher sensitivity in detecting balance improvements compared to other balance scales like the *Berg Balance Scale*.
This means that it is more difficult to reach the max score (ceiling) on the *Mini-BESTest* compared to the *BBS* [@rossCohortStudyComparing2016; @jorgensenComparisonBergBalance2017].

Thus, this test excels at finding balance impairments for *higher* functioning populations than the *Berg Balance Scale*.


# Setup

## Subject Conditions

Subject should be tested with flat-heeled shoes OR shoes and socks off.

## Equipment

1. Temper® foam (also called T-foamTM 4 inches thick, medium density T41 firmness rating)
1. chair without arm rests or wheels
1. Incline ramp
1. Stopwatch
1. A box (9” height)
1. 3 meter distance measured out and marked on the floor with tape [from chair]

# Scoring

The test consists of 14 items which can be scored from 0-2 points.
Therefore the test has a minimum score of 0/28 and a maximum score of 28/28.

For each item, “0” indicates the lowest level of function and “2” the highest level of function.

- **Assistive devices**: If a subject must use an assistive device for an item, score that item one category lower.
- **Physical assistance**: If a subject requires physical assistance to perform an item, score “0” for that item.

### 1 Sit-to-stand {#form-sit-to-stand}

Instruction: “Cross your arms across your chest. Try not to use your hands unless you must. Do not let your legs lean
against the back of the chair when you stand. Please stand up now.”


::: {.callout-note}
"Note the initiation of the movement, and the use of the subject’s hands on the seat of the chair, the
thighs, or the thrusting of the arms forward."

### 2 Rise to toes {#form-rise-to-toes}

Instruction: “Place your feet shoulder width apart. Place your hands on your hips. Try to rise as high as you can onto your
toes. I will count out loud to 3 seconds. Try to hold this pose for at least 3 seconds. Look straight ahead. Rise now.”

::: {.callout-note}
"Allow the subject two attempts. Score the best attempt. (If you suspect that subject is using less than full
height, ask the subject to rise up while holding the examiners’ hands.) Make sure the subject looks at a
non-moving target 4-12 feet away"

### 3 Single leg static balance {#form-slb}

Instruction: “Look straight ahead. Keep your hands on your hips. Lift your leg off of the ground behind you without touching or
resting your raised leg upon your other standing leg. Stay standing on one leg as long as you can. Look straight ahead. Lift
now.”


To score each side separately use the trial with the longest time.
To calculate the sub-score and total score use the side [left or right] with the lowest numerical score [i.e. the worse side].

<script>
    let timers = [null, null, null, null];
    let startTimes = [0, 0, 0, 0];
    let elapsedTimes = [null, null, null, null]; // Use null to represent uninitialized trials
    let isRunning = [false, false, false, false];

    document.getElementById("item3LeftTrial1TimerButton").addEventListener("click", () => toggleTimer(0, "item3LeftTrial1", "item3LeftTrial1TimerButton"));
    document.getElementById("item3RightTrial1TimerButton").addEventListener("click", () => toggleTimer(1, "item3RightTrial1", "item3RightTrial1TimerButton"));
    document.getElementById("item3LeftTrial2TimerButton").addEventListener("click", () => toggleTimer(2, "item3LeftTrial2", "item3LeftTrial2TimerButton"));
    document.getElementById("item3RightTrial2TimerButton").addEventListener("click", () => toggleTimer(3, "item3RightTrial2", "item3RightTrial2TimerButton"));

    document.getElementById("item3LeftTrial1UnableButton").addEventListener("click", () => setUnable("item3LeftTrial1"));
    document.getElementById("item3RightTrial1UnableButton").addEventListener("click", () => setUnable("item3RightTrial1"));
    document.getElementById("item3LeftTrial2UnableButton").addEventListener("click", () => setUnable("item3LeftTrial2"));
    document.getElementById("item3RightTrial2UnableButton").addEventListener("click", () => setUnable("item3RightTrial2"));

    function toggleTimer(index, resultId, buttonId) {
        if (!isRunning[index]) {
            startTimer(index, resultId, buttonId);
        } else {
            stopTimer(index, resultId, buttonId);
        }
    }

    function startTimer(index, resultId, buttonId) {
        startTimes[index] = performance.now();
        isRunning[index] = true;
        document.getElementById(buttonId).innerText = "Stop Timer";
        elapsedTimes[index] = 0; // Set to 0 only when the timer is explicitly started
        updateTimer(index, resultId);
    }

    function updateTimer(index, resultId) {
        const currentTime = performance.now();
        elapsedTimes[index] = Math.min(currentTime - startTimes[index], 20000);
        document.getElementById(resultId).innerText = (elapsedTimes[index] / 1000).toFixed(3) + "s";

        if (elapsedTimes[index] < 20000) {
            // Continue updating if under 20 seconds
            timers[index] = requestAnimationFrame(() => updateTimer(index, resultId));
        } else {
            // Stop the timer when 20 seconds is reached
            stopTimer(index, resultId); // This will now properly update the button text
        }
    }

    function stopTimer(index, resultId, buttonId = null) {
        if (isRunning[index]) {
            isRunning[index] = false;
            cancelAnimationFrame(timers[index]);
            if (buttonId) {
                document.getElementById(buttonId).innerText = "Start Timer"; // Update button text
            }
        }
        checkLongestTimes();
    }

    
    let score3;

    function checkLongestTimes() {
        // Compute LLE times
        const item3lleTimes = [
            elapsedTimes[0], // Trial 1 LLE
            elapsedTimes[2], // Trial 2 LLE
        ];
        const item3lleValid = item3lleTimes.filter(time => time !== null && time !== -Infinity);

        // Compute RLE times
        const item3rleTimes = [
            elapsedTimes[1], // Trial 1 RLE
            elapsedTimes[3], // Trial 2 RLE
        ];
        const item3rleValid = item3rleTimes.filter(time => time !== null && time !== -Infinity);

        // Set LLE Final Time
        let item3finalLLETime;
        if (item3lleValid.length > 0) {
            item3finalLLETime = Math.max(...item3lleValid);
            document.getElementById("item3finalLLETime").innerText = `${(item3finalLLETime / 1000).toFixed(3)}`;
        } else {
            item3finalLLETime = "Unable";
            document.getElementById("item3finalLLETime").innerText = "Unable";
        }

        // Set RLE Final Time
        let item3finalRLETime;
        if (item3rleValid.length > 0) {
            item3finalRLETime = Math.max(...item3rleValid);
            document.getElementById("item3finalRLETime").innerText = `${(item3finalRLETime / 1000).toFixed(3)}`;
        } else {
            item3finalRLETime = "Unable";
            document.getElementById("item3finalRLETime").innerText = "Unable";
        }

        // Update scores based on final times
        const item3finalLLEScore = item3calculateScore(item3finalLLETime);
        const item3finalRLEScore = item3calculateScore(item3finalRLETime);

        document.getElementById("item3finalLLEScore").innerText = item3finalLLEScore;
        document.getElementById("item3finalRLEScore").innerText = item3finalRLEScore;

        // Update the smallest time bolding
        boldSmallestTime();

        // Bold the scores if their corresponding final times are bold
        syncBoldWithTimes("item3finalLLETime", "item3finalLLEScore");
        syncBoldWithTimes("item3finalRLETime", "item3finalRLEScore");

        // Set score3 based on which side is bolded
        setScore3(item3finalLLETime, item3finalRLETime);

        // Calculate the total score
        calculateTotal();
    }


    function item3calculateScore(finalTime) {
        if (finalTime === "Unable") {
            return 0;
        }
        
        const timeInSeconds = finalTime / 1000;

        if (timeInSeconds < 20) {
            return 1;
        } else if (timeInSeconds >= 20) {
            return 2;
        }
        
    }





    function boldSmallestTime() {
        const times = [
            { id: "item3finalLLETime", value: document.getElementById("item3finalLLETime").innerText },
            { id: "item3finalRLETime", value: document.getElementById("item3finalRLETime").innerText },
        ];

        // Normalize the times to handle "Unable"
        const normalizedTimes = times.map(time => ({
            id: time.id,
            value: time.value === "Unable" ? -1 : parseFloat(time.value) || Infinity, // Treat "Unable" as the smallest time
        }));

        // Find the smallest normalized time
        let smallestTime = Infinity;
        let smallestTimeId = null;

        for (const time of normalizedTimes) {
            if (time.value < smallestTime) {
                smallestTime = time.value;
                smallestTimeId = time.id;
            }
        }

        // Reset font weight for all times
        times.forEach(time => {
            document.getElementById(time.id).style.fontWeight = "normal";
        });

        // Bold the smallest time
        if (smallestTimeId) {
            document.getElementById(smallestTimeId).style.fontWeight = "bold";
        }
    }

    function syncBoldWithTimes(timeElementId, scoreElementId) {
        const timeElement = document.getElementById(timeElementId);
        const scoreElement = document.getElementById(scoreElementId);

        if (timeElement.style.fontWeight === "bold") {
            scoreElement.style.fontWeight = "bold";
        } else {
            scoreElement.style.fontWeight = "normal";
        }
    }

     function setScore3(item3finalLLETime, item3finalRLETime) {
        // Reset currentScore3 to 0 by default
        let score3 = 0; 

        // Check which time is bolded and calculate the corresponding score
        if (document.getElementById("item3finalLLETime").style.fontWeight === "bold") {
            score3 = item3calculateScore(item3finalLLETime); // Use seconds directly
        } else if (document.getElementById("item3finalRLETime").style.fontWeight === "bold") {
            score3 = item3calculateScore(item3finalRLETime); // Use seconds directly
        }

        
        // Update the score3 display in the element with the class 'score3'
        document.querySelector('.score3').innerText = score3;

        // Return the score3 value
        return score3;
    }

    function setUnable(resultId) {
        const index = getIndexFromResultId(resultId); // Get the corresponding index
        stopTimer(index, resultId, null); // Stop the timer
        elapsedTimes[index] = -Infinity; // Set time to a value that indicates "Unable"
        document.getElementById(resultId).innerText = "Unable"; // Set display to "Unable"
        checkLongestTimes(); // Recheck final times
    }

    function getIndexFromResultId(resultId) {
        // Map result IDs to their respective indices
        switch (resultId) {
            case "item3LeftTrial1": return 0;
            case "item3RightTrial1": return 1;
            case "item3LeftTrial2": return 2;
            case "item3RightTrial2": return 3;
            default: return -1; // Invalid ID
        }
    }
</script>

down. Make sure the subject looks at a non-moving target 4-12 feet ahead. Repeat on other side."

<details>
    <summary>Example</summary>
You have a patient who scores the following:

| Trial | Right | Left |
|-|-|-|
| Trial 1 | 17s | 19s |
| Trial 2 | 20s| 15s |

When scoring **both** legs, you would report the best score from the two trials:

| Right | Left |
|-|-|
| 20s (2/2 pt) | 19s (1/2 pt) |

When calculating the subscore or the overall score, you cannot include both legs, since each item can only be worth 2 points.
Thus, you must choose the leg with the *worse* score, in this case, it would be the left leg.
You would report this items score as follows:

| Item | Time | Score | Level |
|-|-|-|-|
| Item 3 | 19s | 1/2 pt | Moderate |

</details>

<script>
    let item14Tugtime = 0; // Holds the TUG time in ms
    let item14CognitiveTugtime = 0; // Holds the Cognitive TUG time in ms
    let tugInterval = null;
    let cognitiveTugInterval = null;

    // Helper function to update elements by class name
    const updateElementsByClass = (className, textContent) => {
        document.querySelectorAll(`.${className}`).forEach(element => {
            element.textContent = textContent;
        });
    };

    // Helper function to update the score
    const updateScore14 = () => {
        // Check if either time is set to "Unable"
        if (item14Tugtime === null || item14CognitiveTugtime === null) {
            updateElementsByClass('score14', "0");
        } else if (item14Tugtime > 0 && item14CognitiveTugtime > 0) {
            // Compare cognitive TUG time with TUG time
            if (item14CognitiveTugtime >= item14Tugtime * 0.9) {
                updateElementsByClass('score14', "2"); // Score is 2
            } else {
                updateElementsByClass('score14', "1"); // Score is 1
            }
        } else {
            updateElementsByClass('score14', "Not tested"); // Default message
        }

        // Recalculate the totals
        calculateTotal();
    };


    // Helper function to start a timer for item 14
    const item14StartTimer = (className, onComplete) => {
        const elements = document.querySelectorAll(`.${className}`);
        let startTime = Date.now();

        const interval = setInterval(() => {
            const elapsedTime = Date.now() - startTime;
            elements.forEach(element => {
                element.textContent = (elapsedTime / 1000).toFixed(3) + ' s';
            });

            if (typeof onComplete === 'function') {
                onComplete(elapsedTime, interval);
            }
        }, 10);

        return interval;
    };

    // Event listener for the TUG timer button
    document.getElementById('item14TugTimerButton').addEventListener('click', function () {
        const tugButton = this;
        if (tugInterval) {
            clearInterval(tugInterval);
            tugInterval = null;
            tugButton.textContent = "Start";
            updateScore14(); // Update score after stopping the timer
        } else {
            tugButton.textContent = "Stop";
            tugInterval = item14StartTimer('item14TugDisplay', (elapsedTime) => {
                item14Tugtime = elapsedTime; // Save the TUG time
            });
        }
    });

    // Event listener for the Cognitive TUG timer button
    document.getElementById('item14CognitiveTugTimerButton').addEventListener('click', function () {
        const cognitiveTugButton = this;
        if (cognitiveTugInterval) {
            clearInterval(cognitiveTugInterval);
            cognitiveTugInterval = null;
            cognitiveTugButton.textContent = "Start";
            updateScore14(); // Update score after stopping the timer
        } else {
            cognitiveTugButton.textContent = "Stop";
            cognitiveTugInterval = item14StartTimer('item14CognitiveTugDisplay', (elapsedTime) => {
                item14CognitiveTugtime = elapsedTime; // Save the Cognitive TUG time
            });
        }
    });

    // Event listener for the TUG unable button
    document.getElementById('item14TugUnableButton').addEventListener('click', function () {
        if (tugInterval) {
            clearInterval(tugInterval);
            tugInterval = null;
        }
        item14Tugtime = null; // Reset time to 0
        updateElementsByClass('item14TugDisplay', "Unable");
        document.getElementById('item14TugTimerButton').textContent = "Start";
        updateScore14(); // Update score
    });

    // Event listener for the Cognitive TUG unable button
    document.getElementById('item14CognitiveTugUnableButton').addEventListener('click', function () {
        if (cognitiveTugInterval) {
            clearInterval(cognitiveTugInterval);
            cognitiveTugInterval = null;
        }
        item14CognitiveTugtime = null; // Reset time to 0
        updateElementsByClass('item14CognitiveTugDisplay', "Unable");
        document.getElementById('item14CognitiveTugTimerButton').textContent = "Start";
        updateScore14(); // Update score
    });
</script>

<script>
    const initializeTimer = (trialId, timerButtonId, unableButtonId, scoreClass) => {
    const trialElement = document.getElementById(trialId);
    const timerButton = document.getElementById(timerButtonId);
    const unableButton = document.getElementById(unableButtonId);
    const scoreElements = document.querySelectorAll(scoreClass); // Use querySelectorAll to get all matching elements

    let interval = null;
    let elapsedTime = 0;
    const maxTime = 30000; // 30 seconds in milliseconds

    const updateScore = () => {
        let score;
        if (elapsedTime === 0) {
            score = 0;
        } else if (elapsedTime < maxTime) {
            score = 1;
        } else {
            score = 2;
        }

        // Update all score elements
        scoreElements.forEach(scoreElement => {
            scoreElement.textContent = score; // Set the same score for all elements
        });

        // Recalculate the totals
        calculateTotal();
    };

    timerButton.addEventListener('click', () => {
        if (interval) {
            clearInterval(interval); // Pause the timer
            interval = null;
            timerButton.textContent = 'Start Timer';
        } else {
            const startTime = Date.now() - elapsedTime;
            interval = setInterval(() => {
                elapsedTime = Date.now() - startTime;

                if (elapsedTime >= maxTime) {
                    elapsedTime = maxTime;
                    clearInterval(interval);
                    interval = null;
                    timerButton.disabled = true; // Disable the timer button after max time
                }

                trialElement.textContent = (elapsedTime / 1000).toFixed(3) + ' s';
                updateScore();
            }, 10); // Update every 10ms

            timerButton.textContent = 'Pause Timer';
        }
    });

    unableButton.addEventListener('click', () => {
        if (interval) {
            clearInterval(interval); // Stop the timer if running
            interval = null;
            timerButton.textContent = 'Start Timer';
        }
        elapsedTime = 0; // Reset elapsed time to 0
        trialElement.textContent = 'Unable';
        timerButton.disabled = false; // Re-enable the timer button if it was disabled
        updateScore();
    });
};

    // Initialize timers for Items 7, 8, and 9
    initializeTimer('item7trial', 'item7TimerButton', 'item7UnableButton', '.score7');
    initializeTimer('item8trial', 'item8TimerButton', 'item8UnableButton', '.score8');
    initializeTimer('item9trial', 'item9TimerButton', 'item9UnableButton', '.score9');
</script>

<script>

    function setScore(value, element, scoreId) {
        // Update the displayed score in all elements with the scoreId class
        const scoreElements = document.querySelectorAll(`.${scoreId}`);
        scoreElements.forEach(el => el.innerText = value); // Update all instances

        // Reset background color for all elements in the same group
        const elements = document.querySelectorAll(`[data-score-group="${scoreId}"]`);
        elements.forEach(el => el.style.backgroundColor = ''); // Reset all elements

        // Highlight the clicked element with a color based on the score value
        let color;
        switch (value) {
            case 2:
                color = '#aae8a9'; // Color for Normal
                break;
            case 1:
                color = '#f2e9ae'; // Color for Moderate
                break;
            case 0:
                color = '#fa8484'; // Color for Severe
                break;
            default:
                color = ''; // Default (no highlight)
        }
        element.style.backgroundColor = color; // Set the background color

        // Recalculate the totals
        calculateTotal();
    }



    function calculateTotal() {

        // Get the current scores from the spans using class selectors
        const score1 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score1").innerText) || 0;
        const score2 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score2").innerText) || 0;
        const score3 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score3").innerText) || 0;
        const score4 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score4").innerText) || 0;
        const score5 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score5").innerText) || 0;
        const score6 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score6").innerText) || 0;
        const score7 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score7").innerText) || 0;
        const score8 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score8").innerText) || 0;
        const score9 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score9").innerText) || 0;
        const score10 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score10").innerText) || 0;
        const score11 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score11").innerText) || 0;
        const score12 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score12").innerText) || 0;
        const score13 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score13").innerText) || 0;
        const score14 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score14").innerText) || 0;

        // Calculate the total score
        const anticipatory_subtotal = score1 + score2 + score3;
        const reactive_subtotal = score4 + score5 + score6;
        const sensory_orientation_subtotal = score7 + score8 + score9;
        const dynamic_gait_subtotal = score10 + score11 + score12 + score13 + score14;
        const total = score1 + score2 + score3 + score4 + score5 + score6 + score7 + score8 + score9 + score10 + score11 + score12 + score13 + score14;

        document.querySelectorAll('.anticipatory_subtotal').forEach((element) => {
            element.innerText = anticipatory_subtotal;
        });
        document.querySelectorAll('.reactive_subtotal').forEach((element) => {
            element.innerText = reactive_subtotal;
        });
        document.querySelectorAll('.sensory_orientation_subtotal').forEach((element) => {
            element.innerText = sensory_orientation_subtotal;
        });
        document.querySelectorAll('.dynamic_gait_subtotal').forEach((element) => {
            element.innerText = dynamic_gait_subtotal;
        });
        document.querySelectorAll('.totalScore').forEach((element) => {
            element.innerText = total;
        });

    }

</script>

        scoresToCopy.push(`Anticipatory Subtotal: ${document.querySelector('.anticipatory_subtotal').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 4 Forward compensatory step: ${document.querySelector('.score4').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 5 Backward compensatory step: ${document.querySelector('.score5').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 6 Lateral compensatory step: ${document.querySelector('.score6').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Reactive Postural Control Subtotal: ${document.querySelector('.reactive_subtotal').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 7 Static balance (Feet together + EO): ${document.querySelector('.score7').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 8 Static balance (Feet together + EC + FOAM): ${document.querySelector('.score8').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 9 Incline + EC Balance: ${document.querySelector('.score9').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Sensory Orientation Subtotal: ${document.querySelector('.sensory_orientation_subtotal').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 10 Change in gait speed: ${document.querySelector('.score10').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 11 Gait + Horizontal head turns: ${document.querySelector('.score11').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 12 Gait + Pivot: ${document.querySelector('.score12').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 13 Step over Obstacle: ${document.querySelector('.score13').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 14 TUG + TUG Cog: ${document.querySelector('.score14').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Dynamic Gait Subtotal: ${document.querySelector('.dynamic_gait_subtotal').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Total: ${document.querySelector('.totalScore').innerText}`);

        // Join the scores with new line character
        let textToCopy = scoresToCopy.join('\n');

        // Create a temporary textarea element to hold the text
        let tempTextArea = document.createElement('textarea');
        tempTextArea.value = textToCopy;

        // Append the textarea to the body (required for the copy command)
        document.body.appendChild(tempTextArea);

        // Select the text in the textarea
        tempTextArea.select();

        // Copy the text to the clipboard
        document.execCommand('copy');

        // Remove the temporary textarea
        document.body.removeChild(tempTextArea);

        // Optional: Alert the user that the text has been copied
        alert('Scores copied to clipboard!');
    });
</script>
